messages.message: Although there is an adjustment marker, can't adjust the view size. cc @Serena
cc @Arjun were there recent changes here?
Happening in both sandbox and localhost (running on quite a recent version).
not that I know of. Just tried on sandbox in the class panel and in the field editor and wasn’t able to reproduce

hmm i’m also unable to reproduce on aihub-sandbox :confused_dog:

@Sunny Khatri can you provide a link to your project for us to double check?
Tried a completely new project. Same issue.
what chrome version are you using? i think we’ll need to hop on a screenshare since we’re not able to reproduce on our side, even with the same project you’re using
Let me know. We can get on a call.
@Arjun are you using the latest chrome version? i’m on a slightly older one rn

we found that dragging to resize worked in the following cases for Sunny
• Build projects in Safari
• Converse projects in Chrome
• Pollen storybook page for `DragResize` in Chrome
however, dragging to resize didn’t work for Build projects in Chrome, even after a hard refresh, so it seems to be something specific to the usage of `DragResize` in Build

Sunny also mentiond that he’s been seeing this issue for a couple of weeks, so the issue may not be related to the chrome version
i just updated to the latest chrome version (ie the same version Sunny is using), and i’m still unable to reproduce the issue
Im afk rn but would be curious to test another thing. We also use the drag resize component in build for udf logs. Does that work?
i was going to ask Sunny to try that out, but he doesn’t have any UDFs in his Build projects, and he wanted to get back to debugging the actual issue he’s working on
I just tried quitting chrome completely and restarting. Hitting the same issue.
I wonder if it could be related to chrome on Mac versions. But since it seems to be working at other surfaces, I doubt that.

unfortunately, if we aren’t able to reproduce on our own laptops, we’ll need to debug via screenshare with people who do encounter this issue

maybe if someone else encounters this issue, we’ll have more people to debug with
